verses.roman:
nārāyaṇa-paṇḍita eka baḍa-i udāra
caitanya-caraṇa vinu nāhi jāne āra

synonyms: nārāyaṇa-paṇḍita—of the name Nārāyaṇa Paṇḍita; eka—one; baḍai—very; udāra—liberal; caitanya-caraṇa—the lotus feet of Lord Caitanya; vinu—except; nāhi—not; jāne—know; āra—anything else.
translation: Nārāyaṇa Paṇḍita, the fourteenth branch, a great and liberal devotee, did not know any shelter but Lord Caitanya's lotus feet.

purport.content: Nārāyaṇa Paṇḍita was one of the associates of Śrīvāsa Ṭhākura. It is mentioned in the Caitanya-bhāgavata, Ninth Chapter, verse 93, that he went to see Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu at Jagannātha Purī with Ṭhākura's brother Śrī Rāma Paṇḍita.
